Nightshift keeps tabs on Scourge, being sure he keeps his distance.

" Good=
 question, I think we better keep tabs on him.  Know'n that slagball, he's =
look'n ta stir up some trouble.  But I don't think he eats kittens."

Tucso=
n looks to Hydras,with a sarcastic expression.

"If you think you can do be=
tter, be my guest."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug =
11, 2011, at 4:40 PM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:

>=
 Elita/Hydras:
>  
> Elita paled and slight shaken qhen Sourge was around a=
nd she asked in low voice to  Nightshift =E2=80=9Cdo you think that scourge=
 eats little kittens?=E2=80=9D
>  
>  
> *****************************
>  
=
> hYDRAS hissed anoyed and said =E2=80=9CWhat a waste of power, this saberb=
ack could have done a better use of his skills=E2=80=9D
>  
>

dy Panico

ps.com
> Subject: Re: Strange meetings - the Silver Dragon and the Preds
> =
 
> 
> 
> With deep breaths, Tucson cools down as nostrils flair to allow f=
aster cooling of his systems.  At the same time he raises his neck for anot=
her look around.  Then his head is swung ahead facing northward once again.=
  His long tail snaps at the ground beneath him, taking out what remains of=
 the dinosaur bones, smashing them to splinters.  It felt good to roar, it =
helped to release trapped emotions that had built up over time.  Certainly =
Rodimus was trying his patience and it was a good method of not lashing out=
 at him which would have been a grave mistake.  He continues to wait for th=
e Fuzors to arrive.  He thinks to himself as he does.
>  
> " Till all are =
one.   I most certainly hope you're right about this,Primus.  Our lives dep=
end on your theory."
>  
> Meanwhile, having been above in Waspinator's gra=
sp, Straight Shot could actually sense some good attributes in him if there=
 were any to be sensed.  Although they could never be allies she still coul=
d sense something positive about him.  His sense of sticking to things even=
 if he didn't like doing them, was admirable and she felt he should be comp=
lemented.
>  
> " Waspinator, look I know you hate me with a passion and yo=
u aren't exactly on my friends list but I want you to know that I really ad=
mire your loyalty toward this mission and having the tolerance to work with=
 an enemy bot.  You're doing a really good job, keep it up."
> 
> Perpetual=
ly on the move and constantly busy.
> 
> On Aug 11, 2011, at 12:25 PM, Supe=
r Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
> 
>>  
>> > <OLD>
>> >
>> > Tu=
cson looks to Hydras with a stern expression. He then back at Rodimus.
>> >=

>> > "So you chose to continue. Good, this time try to refrain from making=
 snide
>> > comments. AND HYDRAS, IF YOU SO MUCH AS TURN ON ANY OF US THIS =
ALLIANCE IS
>> > OVER! AM I UNDERSTOOD!?"
>> >
>> > He gives him a serious =
glare.
>> 
>> <NEW>
>> 
>> For a moment RODIMUS just stopped as TUSCON spok=
e and then turned and
>> looked at him, his face a soldier's face. "We will=
 talk later." And
>> then he turned back to continue on his path, shifting =
into his
>> vehicular mode as he moved.
>> 
>> Above him CYCLONUS floated, =
a large jet, his wings positioned for
>> atmospheric flight. "If it means a=
nything you were not given a
>> warrior's chance in battle." CYCLONUS said =
quietly to RODIMUS, "That
>> was wrong. If we fight, it will not be from a =
stab in the back or a
>> reprogramming, it will be machine to machine weapo=
n to weapon."
>> 
>> There was a grunt from RODIMUS, "You know Cyclonus, I =
almost look
>> foward to that."
>> 
>> The two drove on, trying to find a w=
ay for mortal enemies to work together.
>> > <OLD <Tuscon>
>> >
>> > STAND =
BY ALL SOLDIERS! DEPLOYING SONAR ATTACK AT FULL STRENGTH!"
>> >
>> > With a=
 deep breath, Tucson rattles the horizon with a sensor splitting sonic
>> >=
 inhibited roar. A wave of sonar energy is cast from his throat and powerfu=
l
>> > vocalizers. Sharp teeth and fangs glimmer in the moonlight as a stro=
ng
>> > silver tail thrashes the ground beneath his four feet.
>> 
>> As TU=
SCON's warning is heard the Predacons shift their audio circuits
>> off as =
they glance back at at the large dragon.
>> 
>> >>>RRROOOAAARRR!!!<<<
>> 
>=
> TUSCON's roar can be heard for hundreds of miles as the sound of it
>> ec=
hoes and re-echoes out across the miles and miles of dead dinosaurs.
>> One=
 of the first things he reailzes is that although capable of large
>> amoun=
ts of damage, It is rougher and cruder in its sensory mode, but
>> capable =
of far more damage then he could once deliver before.
>> 
>> It is almost l=
ike a wind has picked up and blown some of the bodies
>> back. Dinosaurs th=
at are caught in the cone of effect are broken and
>> tossed about, bones v=
ibrating and then snapped as if hit by a tidal
>> wave, although instead of=
 one of water, this one is made of sound.
>> 
>> No, it was not the same as=
 his original sonar, but it was very effective indeed!
>> 
>> Around TUSCON=
 the Predacons, as well as probrably the Maximals leaped
>> out of the way =
as the cones sweeps through. At high enough levels
>> sound can do actual p=
hysical damage and not just bust ear drums and
>> over load audio circuits.=

>> 
>> As the roar dies down, the damage that is done is incredible and
>>=
 TUSCON's energy cells are slowly trying to recharge themselves from
>> suc=
h a high energy output (OOC: He has to catch his breath). Across
>> the sen=
sors there is no evidence of anyone being affected beyond the
>> dead dinos=
aurs and the movement of TUSCON's allies.
>> 
>> As far as anyone could tel=
l either their enemy was out of range of
>> TUSCON's roar or was protected =
by them in some manner.
>> 
>> "That was interesting." SKY SHADOW said from=
 his position next to
>> HYDRAS as he shrugged his shoulders.
>> 
>> "And l=
oud!" INJECTOR said as he buzzed near by. He was in beast mode
>> looking l=
ike a strange cross of lionfish and hornet.
>> 
>> CYCLONUS and RODIMUS con=
tinued up towards the path of devastation left
>> by the dinosaurs, RODIMUS=
 weaving between the bodies in vehicle mode
>> while CYCLONUS just flew abo=
ve them as a jet.
>> 
>> (TAG)
>> 
>> Preston
>> 
>

<div>With deep breaths, Tucson cools down as nostrils fla=
ir to allow faster 
cooling of his systems.  At the same time he raise=
s his neck for another 
look around.  Then his head is swung ahead fac=
ing northward once 
again.  His long tail snaps at the ground beneath =
him, taking out what 
remains of the dinosaur bones, smashing them to splin=
ters.  It felt good to 
roar, it helped to release trapped emotions th=
at had built up over time.  
Certainly Rodimus was trying his patience=
 and it was a good method of not 
lashing out at him which would have been =
a grave mistake.  He continues to 
wait for the Fuzors to arrive.&nbsp=
; He thinks to himself as he does.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>" Till all =
are one.   I most certainly hope you're right about 
this,Primus.=
  Our lives depend on your theory."</div>
<div> </div>
<div>Meanw=
hile, having been above in Waspinator's grasp, Straight Shot could 
actuall=
y sense some good attributes in him if there were any to be sensed.  
=
Although they could never be allies she still could sense something positiv=
e 
about him.  His sense of sticking to things even if he didn't like =
doing 
them, was admirable and she felt he should be complemented.</div>
<d=
iv> </div>
<div>" Waspinator, look I know you hate me with a passion a=
nd you aren't exactly 
on my friends list but I want you to know that I rea=
lly admire your loyalty 
toward this mission and having the tolerance to wo=
rk with an enemy bot.  
You're doing a really good job, keep it up."</=
div>
<div><br>Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. </div>
